2013-Nov-12 14:49:42 by moate:
What's the status on this one?

2013-Nov-12 16:55:32 by edquist:
The current condor.spec includes this line in the %files section:

@CPACK_RPM_INSTALL_FILES@

which should expand to the list of files that get built by cmake, but for some reason it includes the subdirs all the way up, like /usr/bin ... Looks like this is a known (but unloved) bug: 

  http://public.kitware.com/Bug/view.php?id=13609
  http://public.kitware.com/Bug/view.php?id=12864

Part of me is surprised, since I thought it was legal for multiple rpms to own the same directory... But maybe not in Fedora?

Anyway, off hand I don't know the best way to fix it. Can we put something into the %install section to remove system dirs from that install files list?

Otherwise you can wait for the unified rpm, which should not have this particular problem...

2018-Sep-04 10:22:41 by tim:
Fedora now builds via rpmbuild which fixes this problem.
